text: I'm not known for fancy desserts and
this isn't a fancy dessert either but
it's a dessert that looks good enough so
you could fool a few people it's called
profiteroles and it's on the menu of
many fancy restaurants where they fool
you a whole time starts with 3/4 of a
cup of water and 3/8 of a cup of butter
and a tiny bit of salt and we just bring
that to a boil and once that's boiling
dump in your flour 3/4 of a cup and you
get this ungodly mess and that's got to
cool off a little bit okay now you add
the eggs one at a time add each egg and
beat it in and this actually takes
old-fashioned elbow grease when the egg
is beaten in and the dough starts
looking like a dough again and the
muscle in your side over here starts to
hurt you put in the next egg this
episode is called the minimalist works
okay see starting to look good again
right it will come back together here we
go get your trusty ziploc bag ziploc
trademark that is a heavy-duty plastic
bag with a zipper enclosure you know you
could go to cooking school for this but
you don't have to cut that little corner
off and now these are a lot like
popovers and you bake them the same way
that 400 425 degrees for 20 or 25
minutes or so until they're nicely brown
and crisp we're gonna serve these with
ice cream and some raspberries pureed
with a little bit of water that's it so
take some raspberries dump them in a
food processor just enough water to let
the food processor do its work which is
like a tablespoon and you get that you
want to eat these pretty soon after you
make them but you want them to cool off
also but when they're cool they're light
they're crisp they are like popovers
you'd think a nice one cut the top off a
little bit ice cream in there mmm
dessert they're light they're pretty
they're fancy there is a little bit of
physical work involved I'll admit it but
they're totally worth it
